comments.html: There's another blog post right there 🤣 Thank you!
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
It would be nice if it covered IEEE 802.2/802.3 also.

Frames are Ethernet II if the "Ethertype"/"Length" is greater than 0x05DC, otherwise its 802.3. Funny.

Also, I read somewhere that preambles can be different, but haven't checked.
comments.name: Livio Zanol

comments.html:
EtherType? What do you mean EtherType?

There are/were 4 types of Ethernet encapsulation. Only one of them (arpa encaps) has an EtherType. The other 3 encapsulations do not have an EtherType field. You could have made this story a lot more complex and confusing. If you wanted. :) A missed opportunity. :)
comments.name: Henk
